reviews.title: A Tale of Two Worlds
reviews.text: When you enter the main lobby of La Val you are greeted warmly with prosecco and a smile. The lobby is perfect Alpine chic, smokers are lucky to have a beautiful cigar room, non-smokers have to sit in a small area next to the reception. As we walked towards our room, which was located in an adjacent building we felt like crossing a boarder from the high end of town to the middle class. Gone are the earth tones replaced with red carpet. Gone are the snow gear of yesteryear hanging on the walls. In fact you feel like you are in another hotel, one that has been decorated 30 years ago.

The good news is the room is a reasonable size and has a small terrace. Shower pressure is strong and for the first time, in a long time, the towel warmer actually warms. I just wish that the feel of the lobby would have inspired more in the room.
reviews.title: Beautifully done, but room for improvement

reviews.text: The food is average. For us a four course menu was included with the room price, so your options are limited, but they do support vegetarian. Breakfast has the basics - so don't expect anything special here. They advertise that coffee and cake are included in half board but we never got a glimpse of that cake ...
reviews.title: Superb hotel in beautiful,quiet location....
